tasks.name: commit
tasks.title: Adds and commits, a brief summary, since the last commit following all git commit guidelines
what to do: Read all files in the .project folder for project requirements and standards.
Read all root documentation files: README.md, TECHNICAL.md.
Analyze all changes made since the last commit.
If possible, group related changes into logical units for separate commits.
For each commit, write a concise summary that follows git commit guidelines.
Follow these git commit guidelines as much as possible
- Separate subject from body with a blank line
- Limit the subject line to 50 characters
- Capitalize the subject line
- Do not end the subject line with a period
- Use the imperative mood in the subject line
- Wrap the body at 72 characters
- Use the body to explain what and why
- Mention any related issues or tasks from backlog.md by their IDs
Stage the changes for commit.
Create the commit with the written summary.
Do not push the commits to the remote repository.

tasks.name: analyze-project
tasks.title: Comprehensive repository analysis and health assessment
what to do: Perform a systematic analysis of the entire repository to assess project health, consistency, and completeness.
**Repository Scan**: Use file_search and list_dir to catalog ALL files in the repository including code, configs, docs, tests, scripts, and any other files.
**Documentation Review**: Read all .project files, root documentation (README.md, TECHNICAL.md, CHANGELOG.md), and any other markdown files.
**Code Analysis**: Review key code files (app/, src/, models.py, config.py, etc.) for consistency and alignment with documentation.
**Configuration Assessment**: Check all configuration files (pyproject.toml, Makefile, docker-compose.yml, .env templates, etc.) for consistency and completeness.
**Test Coverage**: Analyze test files and validate that testing infrastructure matches documentation claims.
**File Structure Validation**: Verify the actual directory structure matches what's documented in architecture.md and README.md.
**Cross-Reference Verification**: Check that file paths referenced in documentation actually exist and are correct.
**Dependency Analysis**: Verify that imports, references, and dependencies are consistent across files.
**Standards Compliance**: Check adherence to project standards defined in plan.md and goals.md.
**Gap Identification**: Identify missing files, outdated references, inconsistent information, and areas needing attention.
**Quality Assessment**: Evaluate overall project organization, maintainability, and developer experience.
**Actionable Recommendations**: Provide specific, prioritized recommendations for improvements with clear rationale.
Do not git add or commit any changes.
Include the following sections in your response:
# Comprehensive Repository Analysis
## Repository File Inventory
## Documentation Consistency Check
## Code-Documentation Alignment
## Configuration Completeness
## File Structure Validation
## Cross-Reference Verification
## Standards Compliance Assessment
## Identified Issues and Gaps
## Project Health Score
## Prioritized Recommendations
## Next Steps
